sub_topic: Identifying the maximum independent set in a graph.
message_2:
To find the maximum independent set of vertices in G, we first need to understand the structure of the graph. The adjacency matrix represents the connections between the vertices:

0 - 1 - 2 - 3 - 4
|       |       |
+-------+-------+
|       |       |
3 - 2 - 1 - 0 - 1

From the adjacency matrix and the graph structure, we can see that the graph is bipartite. In a bipartite graph, the maximum independent set can be found by selecting all the vertices in one of the two disjoint sets. In this case, we can choose either the set {0, 2, 4} or the set {1, 3}. Both sets have 3 vertices, so the maximum independent set of vertices in G has a size of 3.

Thus, the maximum independent set of vertices in G is either {0, 2, 4} or {1, 3}.
